name: places/ChIJ6QEZNBRawokRBZ96FkrvdPk
formattedAddress: 55 Water St, New York, NY 10041, USA
adrFormatAddress: 55 Water St, New York, NY 10041, USA

originalText.text:
Pretty much the only parking garage along this side of the pier. Has an extensive pre-arrival security check where 1 guy will examine the vehicle’s underside and also check the trunk.

My problem is how they have priced it and refuse to justify the costs. In my situation, we had 2 cars, a hatchback and an SUV. The hatch was parked for 2h 8min and the SUV was parked for 2h 5min. The billing difference was $13- $42 for the SUV and $55 for the hatch.

When I asked the attendant why the prices are different for both vehicles, they said “it’s just the way it is”.
Like, tf kind of a reply is that?!

Also, if you have a large vehicle such as a full sized SUV, I recommend you find another place because the level 4 parking where they direct you is extremely tight to park in.

originalText.text: Was 3 minutes early for my prepaid reservation (without thinking much of it because it’s literally 3 minutes) and was charged an additional $50 upon leaving because it was outside that time window. Then was told they can’t accept cards at the moment and had to go find an ATM. Then was simply handed my keys and was left to go down 4 levels and find the location of my car on my own.

originalText.text: Excellent parking for Governor's Island, especially if booking ahead with SpotHero.

text.text: Excellent parking for Governor's Island, especially if booking ahead with SpotHero.

originalText.text: Worst experience ever with parking anywhere. I booked online, while entering, found the entrance was closed with an orange cone. Waiting.... after a while an Indian man came. He received a personal call and he kept talking over cell phone in a foreign language (not English). I kept waiting and waiting.... after a while... he was writing my car information in one hand and holding cell phone with the other hand and kept talking. One point he told me "Wait" and left towards the booth. I was waiting ... according to online instructions, "I pressed the button and took the ticket". Seeing that came towards me and shouting with top of his voice "WHY DID YOU MOVE?  I TOLD YOU TO STAY THERE...". I politely replied, I didn't move, just took the ticket.... He didn't let me finish. Started shouting again.. "I TOLD YOU TO WAIT. DID I TELL YOU TO TAKE THE TICKET..?" I was trying to mention it was online instruction... He didn't let me finish or listen to what I was saying, kept shouting at the top of his voice, "WHY DID YOU TAKE THE TICKET? ". It didn't end there, he kept shouting and shouting and shouting....... I felt so humiliated before my wife and child. My entering time and date is 7-30-22. 10:41 am. We selected the parking garage so we could visit the Statue of Liberty. He ruined the day not only for me or my wife. From my kid as well.

originalText.text: If it allowed me to - I would give less than one star. The rudeness and unprofessionalism of the staff here beggars belief. A combination of ineptitude and rudeness create a typically frustrating experience. Avoid at all costs. Too many experiences to detail - but rest assured if not not insulted, treated rudely or yelled at you should consider it a non-typical experience and yourself extremely lucky. Pre-pandemic it was just one miserably rude "Security" attendant - seems he was promoted to lead employee training for the whole team.
